result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole Elizabeth Steltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Shall follow recommendations by the DOC regarding AODA, psychological and criminal thinking

15CF24, 15CF25 & 15CF282 - Defendant Nicole Elizabeth Steltz in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Vollan heard, requesting court not revoke DPA and modify bond to a signature amount, def unable to post cash bail.  Atty Klomberg heard on request to revoke DPA based on failure to comply and termination from the TAD program.  Atty Vollan responds;  contesting revocation, def would like to re-enter the TAD program.  Court heard.  Atty Jacquelyn Shelton appears late on behalf of defendant.  Court marks Revocation Request Form as exhbit 1.  Court revokes DPA and finds def guilty in Count 1 of 15CF24, Count 1 in 15CF25 & Count 1 in 15CF282.  Court denies any bail modification.  State is requesting PSI, court so orders.  Sentencing to be scheduled in 60 days.

w/15CF24 & 282:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(15CF24, 15CF25, 15CF282): Defendant Nicole Elizabeth Steltz in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Vollan heard on Def.'s FTA (appearing for CF cases only, Atty. Shelton is on the PA case); State heard on bond, prior FTAs, criminal history, removed from TAD DPA program, $50,000 CASH; Atty. Vollan response, will be living with her parents in BD; Court sets $20,000 Cash bond:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  MH reset to 12/9/15 at 11am in Br. 4
